Legal_Issue: Assessment of state protection for applicants
Evidence_Assessment: Board failed to analyze documents showing systemic human rights issues in Mexico
Legal_Rule: Standard of review is patent unreasonableness
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider relevant evidence and properly assess state protection
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk due to exposure of corruption and lack of effective state protection in Mexico
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board ignored facts and failed to analyze key documents
Key_Evidence_Considered: Threats and persecution after exposing corruption, attempts to seek state protection worsening situation, systemic human rights issues in Mexico
Applicant_Challenge: Incorrect assessment of 'state protection' by the Board
Court_Result: Case remitted for redetermination by a differently constituted panel
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of human rights issues, personal testimony of threats and persecution
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of effective state protection in country of origin
Jurisdiction: Canada (implied by reference to Board and judicial review process)
Governing_Rule: Patent unreasonableness standard in administrative law
